block.p: Sarah Williams Ludden, the daughter of Susan W. Ludden and Dr. John M. Ludden of Lincoln, Mass., was married yesterday to Anthony Paul Deighton, a son of Erica R. Deighton and Dr. John A. Deighton of Cambridge, Mass. The Rev. Edward Hardy performed the ceremony at the Unitarian Universalist Meeting House in Chatham, Mass.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Northwestern University, where they met.

Sarah Williams Ludden, the daughter of Susan W. Ludden and Dr. John M. Ludden of Lincoln, Mass., was married yesterday to Anthony Paul Deighton, a son of Erica R. Deighton and Dr. John A. Deighton of Cambridge, Mass. The Rev. Edward Hardy performed the ceremony at the Unitarian Universalist Meeting House in Chatham, Mass.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Northwestern University, where they met.

Mrs. Deighton, 27, is a search consultant in the San Francisco office of Futurestep.com, an Internet subsidiary of Korn/Ferry International, the executive search firm. Her father, who retired as a senior vice president for medical affairs at Harvard Pilgrim Healthcare, is the director of the joint medical and business degree program at Tufts University Medical School in Boston. Her mother teaches art in the Lincoln, Mass., public schools.

Mr. Deighton, 26, is a product manager for Siebel Systems, a computer software company in San Mateo, Calif. He received an M.B.A. degree from the Harvard Business School, where his father is a professor of marketing. The bridegroom's mother, a doctoral candidate in clinical psychology at the Illinois School of Professional Psychology, is doing an internship at McLean Hospital in Belmont, Mass.
